title: Gomer Overcomes the Obstacle Course
description: Gomer gets his first shot at the obstacle course.

title: Guest in the Barracks
description: Gomer helps a recruiter smuggle his girlfriend into the barracks.

title: Private Ralph Skunk
description: While on a hike Gomer makes a friend, but when the friend decides to move into the barracks Sgt Carter wants him gone! but Gomer shows the Sgt what an asset this new friend is to the platoon.

title: Captain Ironpants
description: After tipping his hat instead of saluting female Captain "Iron Pants" Martin, Gomer is assigned special detail in her office to teach him a lesson, but it turns out that he is the teacher instead of the student as he reminds her that she is more then just a Marine.

title: Gomer Learns a Bully
description: A trouble maker transfers into the platoon and decides to make Pyle his patsy, Gomer tries to handle it with understanding and kindness - but soon learns that bullies need to be stood up against.

title: Pay Day
description: After being bawled out by Sgt Carter for not working hard enough Gomer decides not accept his pay for that week which causes all sorts of troubles for Sgt Carter.

title: Nobody Loves a Sergeant
description: Sgt Carter tries to make Gomer dislike him before graduation, feeling that he hasn't done his job correctly if he isn't hated by ALL the recruits. Sgt Carter asks for a transfer to California, but things don't go quite as he expects.

title: Gomer and the Dragon Lady
description: While in town on pass Sgt Carter decides to play a joke on Gomer by setting him on a quest to get a kiss from "The Dragon Lady" but in order for it to work he will need Duke's help.

title: Survival of the Fattest
description: It's Survival Training for the platoon, for 5 days partners have to rough it. Thinking Gomer will bring down the rating for the platoon, Sgt Carter takes Pyle as his own partner. Carter soon learns that Gomer's small-town, backwoods upbringing turns out to be an asset

title: A Date for the Colonel's Daughter
description: The Colonel's daughter visits from her all-girls school and the Colonel asks Sgt Carter to find her an escort, so of course Gomer Pyle is the perfect choice - at least until her overly protective mother panics.

title: They Shall Not Pass
description: Sgt Carter's platoon takes part in war games, and Gomer's naive ways cause more problems than Sgt Carter can handle. Will Gomer's actions get Carter the boot?

title: Sergeant Carter, Marine Baby Sitter
description: Gomer and his fellow Marines are headed into town on day passes when one of them is stuck on guard duty. Gomer volunteers to help his buddy's wife take care of things for the baby - but Sgt Carter "volunteers" to drive them around leaving his date on hold.

title: The Case of the Marine Bandit
description: While hitching a ride to town Gomer stops to help a stranded motorist, she takes him into town to meet her mother. A robber is holding up liquor stores while wearing a Marine's uniform at the same time.

title: Sergeant of the Week
description: A mix-up leads Carter to believe Gomer's dying.

title: Grandpa Pyle's Good Luck Charm
description: Gomer's grandpa offers pointers on drilling a platoon.

title: Dance, Marine, Dance
description: Gomer's conned into signing a contract for dancing lessons.

title: Sergeant Carter's Farewell to His Troops
description: Carter must decide whether or not to re-enlist.

title: The Feuding Pyles
description: Gomer makes friends with a hillbilly named Branch.

title: Love Letters to the Sarge
description: Carter receives anonymous love letters.

title: Sergeant Carter Gets a Dear John Letter
description: Carter asks Gomer to take his place on a date.

title: Daughter of the Sarge
description: Carter's adopted Korean daughter arrives-but she's not the little girl he remembers.

title: Officer Candidate Gomer Pyle
description: Carter tries for the Officer Candidate School.

title: Old Man Carter
description: Gomer tries to collect money for Carter's birthday.

title: Gomer Makes the Honor Guard
description: Carter may have to use Gomer as an honor guard since he owns a blue dress uniform.

title: My Buddy, the War Hero
description: Carter and an old war buddy credit each other for being war heroes.

title: Double Date with the Sarge
description: Gomer decides to find a girl of his own after meeting Sergeant Carter's girlfriend.

title: The Jet Set
description: Duke talks Gomer into taking a jeep to the airport.

title: Sergeant of the Guard
description: Gomer is a look-out for burglars robbing the base.

title: Gomer Dates a Movie Star
description: Gomer's favorite actress visits the base.

title: Gomer the M.P.
description: Gomer gets assigned to MP duty.

title: PFC Gomer Pyle
description: Carter wants his men to pass a promotion test.

title: Third Finger, Left Loaf
description: Gomer holds a wedding ring for a friend and it appears to be lost when they spend a night baking bread.

title: The Blind Date
description: Sergeant Carter's date has a friend she doesn't want to leave alone so she tells the Sergeant that it's a double date or nothing. As a last resort the Sergeant invites Pyle.

title: Home on the Range
description: Gomer meets a family from N. Carolina who have encountered truck problems en route to Oregon so Gomer puts them up in a blasting range cabin untill he has time to fix their truck.

title: Gomer Un-Trains a Dog
description: Gomer volunteers to train "Killer" a German Sheppard intended for sentry duty but turns Killer into a pussycat.

title: Gomer, the Star Witness
description: While sitting in a restaurant, Gomer witnesses an automobile accident between Sergeant Carter and another driver. When in court Gomer takes the oath seriously to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth.

title: A Visit from Cousin Goober
description: When Gomer's cousin Goober shows up in the barracks and puts on one of Gomer's uniforms and then wanders the base, everyone see's the name Pyle on the uniform and thinks Gomer is loosing his mind.

title: A Groom for Sergeant Carter's Sister
Gomer, the Peacemaker
description: Gomer won't rest until he helps to reunite Sergeant Carter with Miss Bunny after they had a lovers spat.

title: Gomer Pyle, P.O.W.
description: Gomer and his platoon engage in "war games" against a rival unit and Pvt. Pyle ends up captured and a prisoner of war. How he copes with his pow status and manages to escape are worth seeing. One of season 2's funniest episodes.

title: Gomer Pyle, Civilian
description: Sergeant Carter orders Pyle to take a week long furlough but instead of going back home to Mayberry, Pyle takes a civilian job on base so he can remain close to the Sergeant.

title: Gomer and the Beast
description: Gomer's acts of kindness towards his new waitress friend is mistaken for romantic interest by her cruel Marine Sargent boyfriend.

title: Grandma Pyle, Fortune Teller
description: Grandma Pyle visits Gomer, reads his fortune and predicts Gomer will cause something bad to happen; then Sergeant Carter looses his voice while yelling at him.

title: Vacation in Las Vegas
description: Gomer wins a trip for two to Las Vegas and takes Sergeant Carter with him. The Sergeant has no money so he has to rely on Gomer for entertainment but Gomer has set an itinerary which include things like visiting a Rock Museum.

title: Opie Joins the Marines
description: Opie Taylor runs away from Mayberry to join the Marines.

title: A Date with Miss Camp Henderson
description: A bet between sergeants and Sergeant Carter's lies result in Gomer dating Miss Camp Henderson and taking her to Lookout Point.

title: Gomer and the Father Figure
description: Both Gomer and Sergeant Carter are conned by an old bum.

title: Desk Job for a Sergeant
description: Sergeant Carter takes a temporary desk job writing training manuals and considers making it permanent when he sees the platoon does fine without him; so Gomer messes things up to bring the Sergeant back.

title: Gomer, the Would-Be Hero
description: Sergeant Carter is in a restaurant with a girl other than his girlfriend when he foils an armed robbery. The Sergeant doesn't want his girlfriend to know he was there with another woman so he pins the credit on Gomer.

title: Lies, Lies, Lies
description: Gomer goes on a Hollywood bus tour, gets off the bus and meets a movie star who he spends the day with but no one believes him.

title: Crazy Legs Gomer
description: Competition between Sergeants leads to competition between platoons as Gomer runs a foot race for Sergeant Carter's platoon. Carter bets against Gomer.

title: Gomer, the Carrier
description: The entire platoon gets German Measles except Gomer, the carrier.

title: Caution: Low Overhead
description: Both Gomer and Sergeant Carter get swindled by a con-man selling faulty goods.

title: Show Me the Way to Go Home
description: Gomer helps a drunkard home twice and is accused of getting him drunk.

title: How to Succeed in Farming Without Really Trying
description: When Gomer takes up gardening, Sergeant Carter spikes a watermelon with liquor, the same watermelon Gomer gives to the Colonel.

title: Gomer and the Little Men from Outer Space
description: Gomer stumbles across a spaceship and little men in space suits. Not knowing they are part of a movie film crew he thinks they are aliens from outer space.

title: The Borrowed Car
description: Gomer takes Sergeant Carters car to deliver charity items for Miss Bunny. The Sergeant reports the car stolen and Gomer wrecks it.

title: Gomer Pyle, Super Chef
description: Gomer works in the mess hall and makes a real mess of things. When a visiting Colonel eats there he gets a real surprise.

title: Marry Me, Marry Me
description: Gomer and Sergeant Carter find themselves engaged to the same married women.

title: Cold Nose, Warm Heart
description: Sergeant Carter feels neglected after getting Miss Bunny a puppy.

title: Follow That Car
description: Gomer and Sgt. Carter are robbed of $650 of radio equipment by 2 armed smugglers.

title: It Takes Two to Tangle
description: It appears that Miss Bunny is cheating on Sergeant Carter but appearances can be deceiving.

title: Whither the Weather
description: Gomers weather forecasts prove to be more accurate than the National Weather Service, that is until it matters most.

title: Love's Old Sweet Song
description: Sergeant Carter and Private Slater are both attracted to the same lounge singer but she is attracted to Gomer Pyle. Jim Neighbors sings "500 Miles Away From Home" to her.

title: Gomer the Recruiter
description: Gomer watches a recruiting booth for Sergeant Carter and recruits a man who just robbed a bank.

title: The Secret Life of Gomer Pyle
description: Gomer doesn't appreciate it when he poses for fun pictures on the beach which are altered and appear in a mens magazine showing Gomer surrounded by women. The guys at camp think Gomer has a secret Sunday life.

title: Go Blow Your Horn
description: Sergeant Carter gets Gomer to try out for the U.S. Marine band. Gomer is accepted into the band as a tuba player but then declines the offer when he learns that he'd be separated from the Sergeant for a year.

title: You Bet Your Won Ton
description: In search of a place to host a going away party for a comrade, Gomer goes into a Chinese restaurant that is a front for a gambling operation.

title: Sue the Pants Off 'Em
description: When a distracted Gomer Pyle almost walks in front of a car and falls backwards, an ambulance chasing attorney teams up with a phony doctor to try to sue the driver of the car, who turns out to be a Marine Major.

title: Gomer and the Card Shark
description: Gomer finds himself caught in the middle between his buddies and a card shark. Gomer is used as a patsy so show that you can win and he wins big.

title: To Re-enlist or Not to Re-enlist
description: Sergeant Carter helps Gomer prepare for transition into civilian life by setting Gomer up with a job, a place to live and even a girlfriend, in hope that Gomer won't re-enlist.

title: Lou-Ann Poovie Sings Again
description: Sergeant Carter acts like a jerk when he and Private Slater are attracted to a lounge singer. Who does she choose? Gomer Pyle, USMC.

title: Gomer, the Welsh Rarebit Fiend
description: In folk tradition, Welsh rarebit is believed to cause nightmares. But when a new restaurant opens near the base and both Pyle and the sergeant indulge in the dish, it's sleepwalking that the simple meal of toast and cheese sauce induces in both men--sleepwalking, and changes in personality.

title: Sing a Song of Papa
description: Gomer wins an amateur nightclub contest singing "Oh My Papa". The club owner tries to intimidate Sergeant Carter into letting Gomer sing it again. Gomer does sing it again, this time in Italian for the club owners papa.

title: Where There's a Will
description: Sergeant Carter sends Gomer on a one week assignment to jump out of airplanes, as a way to get rid of him. When Gomer takes out a life insurance policy and names the sergeant as beneficiary, the sergeant feels guilty.

title: Lost, the Colonel's Daughter
description: Gomer is asked to take out Colonel Gray's daughter, Janice, because the colonel feels that Gomer is very safe. Gomer intends to take her to the movies but Janice, who has been attending an all women's college, has some very different ideas on how to spend an evening, which include going to a discotheque. Gomer winds up losing her and calls Sgt. Carter to help find her. Eventually they track her down to a wild party in Hollywood. Unfortunately, Janet's dress accidentally get's torn and they all are arrested for disturbing the peace. Now they must find a way to explain to the colonel what happened and try not to get into even hotter water.

title: The Crow Ganef
description: Gomer is suspected of stealing when he makes friends with a thieving crow.

title: One of Our Shells Is Missing
description: A live mortar shell goes missing. When Gomer goes off alone looking for it, everyone fears the worse when they hear a distant explosion.

title: Lou-Ann Poovie Sings No More
description: Lounge singer Lou-Ann Poovie gets fired from her job. Private Slater and Sergeant Carter try to get her music deals but Gomer tells her she can't sing. When she hears her own voice played back she quits singing and makes up with Gomer.

title: A Visit from Aunt Bee
description: When Aunt Bee visits the base, she becomes very distraught by Sgt. Carter's treatment of Gomer.

title: The Recruiting Poster
description: An artist comes to Camp Henderson to choose a marine to paint for a recruitment poster. Sergeants Hacker & Carter vie for her eye and in the end she paints Gomer with Sergeant Carters eye.

title: Corporal Carol
description: Carol Burnett co-stars as Corporal Carol who puts the moves on Gomer endangering his relationship with his girlfriend Lou-Ann Poovie.

title: A Leader of Men
description: A visiting congressman from Gomers home area wants him promoted to Corporal but Gomer knows it's not for him.

title: Gomer, the Beautiful Dreamer
description: Whenever Gomer has the same dream three times it comes true.

title: The Great Talent Hunt
description: Sergeants Hacker & Carter put up singers to represent their platoons in a talent contest and then try to sabotage the others entries. Gomer sings.

title: Gomer Says 'Hey' to the President
description: While taking a tour of the White House Gomer gets separated from the tour group and wanders into the oval office.

title: A Child Shall Lead Them
description: Gomer Pyle and Sergeant Carter are conned by a little boy pretending to be lost. Filmed on location in Washington, D.C.

title: The Show Must Go On
description: Gomer overcomes obstacles to perform a brilliant vocal rendition of "The Impossible Dream."

title: The Better Man
description: Lou-Ann Poovie must decide between ex boyfriend Monroe or Gomer when her father butts in. Her dad thinks Gomer is a wimp until Gomer stands up for himself declaring his love for Lou-Ann.

title: To Watch a Thief
description: Gomer thinks Sergeant Carter stole a watch and Gomer reports it to the base Chaplain.

title: The Prize Boat
description: Gomer enters a jingle writing contest and wins a free boat that turns out to be anything but free.

title: Friendly Freddy Strikes Again
description: Friendly Freddy who sells fake goods accidentally sells Gomer a real ring and tries to break-up the relationship between Lou-Ann and Gomer to get the ring back.

title: Change Partners
description: Sergeant Carter and Miss Bunny break-up when Gomer and Lou-Ann tag along on a date. Then Gomer dates Miss Bunny and Lou-Ann dates the Sergeant in attempts to re-unite them with each other.

title: Wild Bull of the Pampas
description: Manuel Cortez comes to America to observe the Marine Corps in action to help him learn about the U.S. military to help his country's armed forces.

title: Gomer, the Good Samaritan
description: Gomer is assigned the responsibility of driving a General from Los Angeles to Camp Henderson but keeps getting sidelined helping people out.

title: Gomer, the Privileged Character
description: Gomer (Jim Nabors) is ordered to sing again and wears himself out as he insists on pulling his own weight by doing his daily chores at night.

title: Gomer Goes Home
description: Gomer spends a week in Mayberry but finds everyone away on vacation so he spends his time working in the filling station and spoiling crime.

title: A Dog Is a Dog Is a Dog
description: Sergeant Carter and Private Pyle are asked to sit for a Colonels dog which runs off. In an attempt to find it they round up three wrong dogs.

title: Luv Finds Gomer Pyle
description: Gomer helps a teenager out by buying her a soda when she doesn't have any money and then she keeps showing up during Gomers dates with Lou-Ann.

title: Gomer and the Queen of Burlesque
description: Sergeant Hacker sets Gomer up with a burlesque dancer as a joke telling him that she's a school teacher from out of town. Gomer wins her over with his charm and when he finds out the truth he accepts her for who she is.

title: The Carriage Waits
description: A baby buggy is accidentally sent to Gomer and he ends up apprehended for shoplifting when he tries to return it to the department store that sent.

title: Sergeant Iago
description: Lou-Ann has a new boss and has to work late during his first week doing inventory. Sergeant Carter leads Gomer to think she's cheating on him.

title: Goodbye, Dolly
description: Gomer buys Dolly, an old horse, to save it from the glue factory, without taking into consideration the question of 'how you hide a horse on a marine base?'

title: The Price of Tomatoes
description: Sgt Carter tries to evict a tomato farmer from secluded base property, but he has the legal right to be there.

title: Chef for a Day
description: Sergeant Carter finally gets Gomer transferred out, to Sergeant Hackers squad. Then Hacker and Carter make a wager with Gomer going to the loser. Sergeant Carter throws the contest to get Gomer Pyle back.

title: Gomer and the Night Club Comic
description: Gomer befriends a night club comedian played by Jerry Van Dyke and helps him gain confidence.

title: Love and Goulash
description: Gomer tells the story of Romeo and Juliette to bring two feuding Hungarian families together who's children are dating against their wishes.

title: And Baby Makes Three
description: Gomer brings a baby on base when the parents he is babysitting for get delayed.

title: Friendly Freddy, the Gentleman's Tailor
description: Gomer and the Sergeant are swindled again by Friendly Freddy, this time buying defective suits.

title: Car for Sale
description: Sergeant Hacker siphons gas out of Sergeant Carters car so Carter thinks that the car is getting poor mileage and sells it to Hacker for a song.

title: Corporal Duke
description: Duke Slater comes back as a Corporal to run the platoon in Sergeant Carter's absence. The men see Slater as a buddy and take advantage of his kindness. Gomer rallies the troops to show Duke respect.

title: The Booty Prize
description: The 'Booty Prize' is an actual lead boot awarded to platoons to embarrass them for mistakes made. Gomer and Sergeants Carter and Hacker all get their foot stuck in it.

title: The Return of Monroe
description: Lou-Ann's old boyfriend, Monroe, returns again. Monroe tells Gomer a lie, that he is going to marry Lou-Ann and it breaks Gomers heart but lies can't stop true love.

title: Just Move Your Lips, Sergeant
description: Sergeant Carter forms a mens choir to be part of a movie but the Sergeants singing is terrible so he's told "just move your lips, Sergeant."

title: All You Need Is One Good Break
description: A beautiful stuntwoman defends herself against two thugs while being escorted by Gomer and Sgt. Carter, and they get the credit for protecting her.

title: A Marriage of Convenience
description: While Company D is in Hollywood to film a movie, a movie starlet with an expired Visa who is facing deportation first proposes marriage to Gomer who says no and then to Sergeant Carter who says yes.

title: A Star Is Not Born
description: Sargent Carter and his platoon are cast in a Marine movie. While Gomer sings, Carter cannot deliver his lines correctly, leading to a different role.

title: Come Blow Your Top
description: Sergeant Hacker bets Sergeant Carter $50 that Carter can't go 24 hours without losing his temper. Then Hacker tries to sabotage Carter.

title: A Little Chicken Soup Wouldn't Hurt
description: Gomer meets an elderly lady whose son is trying to retire her but all she wants to do is cook and take care of others.

title: Gomer, the Perfect M.P.
description: Sergeant Carter puts Gomer on guard duty and orders him not to let anyone enter the base without identification, no exceptions. Then Gomer refuses the sergeant entry when Carter comes back for his forgotten wallet.

title: The Wild Bull Returns
description: General Cortez returns to Camp Henderson and challenges Sergeant Carter for the affections of Miss Bunny.

title: Hit and Write
description: Sergeant Carter hits a new car while parking and slightly scratches it. Gomer insists that the Sergeant leave a note. Then the new car turns up with a badly crashed fender which Carter is blamed for.

title: Two on the Bench
description: Sergeant Carter has trouble finding a ticket for a big football game but Gomer gets them bench passes from a player on the team that Gomer knew from Mayberry.

title: A Tattoo for Gomer
description: Duke draws on Gomers arm. Lou-Ann thinks it's a real tattoo; she hates it but doesn't tell Gomer thinking it's too late. Gomer hates it but goes to make it permanent thinking Lou-Ann likes it. She finds out just in time to stop him.

title: Win-A-Date
description: Sergeant Carter goes on a dating game, Gomer ends up pulled into the show as contestant #3 and wins. Both Miss Bunny and Lou-Ann are upset that their men went on a dating show.

title: Marriage, Sgt. Carter Style
description: Sergeant Carter tries to get Gomer to marry Lou-Ann instead of re-enlisting.

title: To Save a Life
description: Sergeant Carter saves Gomer from a live grenade that Gomer dropped during exercises and Gomer becomes a pest repaying the sergeant for the deed so Carter sets it up for Gomer to save his life. This is an obvious Mayberry rewrite.

title: Dynamite Diner
description: Gomer and Lou-Ann find a diner closed without customers and try to help them build business but the only thing the restaurant owners are interested in is robbing the bank next door through the basement wall.

title: Freddy's Friendly Computer
description: Fast Freddie is in the computer dating service although he doesn't have a computer. He sets Gomer up with a date.

title: Gomer Maneuvers
description: The Marines send Carter's and Hacker's platoons to maneuvers. Hacker tricks Gomer into giving the location of Carter's tents, so they have to move in the middle of the night. Carter accidentally raids a girl scout camp, due to faulty information from Pyle. Carter sends Pyle back to the base. Pyle is captured by Hacker, and then escapes. Pyle visits the girl scouts, Hacker's platoon raids. Carter platoon right behind them, capturing Hacker platoon. Hacker back at the base, pays the $50 lost the bet. A surprise twist at the end leaves Gomer smiling, and both Sargeants disappointed.

title: Gomer Tends a Sick Cat
description: Miss Bunny has a sick cat but Gomer thinks the Sergeant is sick and dying. Gomer consults with Miss Bunny and then treats the Sergeant to warm milk and a ball with a bell.

title: I'm Always Chasing Gomers
description: Gomer gets stuck on Sergeant Carter's plane to Wichita without Carter knowing it; and then Carter keeps seeing Gomer everywhere he looks.

title: The Short Voyage Home
description: Gomer heads home to buy a gas station with his cousin Goober; Sergeant Carter goes with him. Gomer and the Sergeant run into pickpockets. In the end Gomer decides he's better off in the marines with the Sergeant to look after him.

title: Proxy Poppas
description: Gomer and Sergeant Carter help a fellow marine who's wife is having a baby.

title: Flower Power
description: Three hippies help Gomer camouflage a marine van, only they paint bright daisies on it instead.

title: Hare Today, Gone Tomorrow
description: Gomer finds a white rabbit, gives it to a General's son and the Sergeant lets it loose thinking Gomer is keeping an unauthorized bunny. The rabbit must be found and the search is on but there are many white rabbits on base.

title: Showtime with Sgt. Carol
description: Carol Burnett co-stars as a visiting Sergeant putting on a talent show at Camp Henderson. She wants Gomer to sing, Sergeant Carter says no until she uses her ladylike charm on him.

title: My Fair Sister
description: Sergeant Carter's sister arrives and the Sergeant is embarrassed by her looks so he gets her a make-over that just isn't her. Gomer talks her into going back to her old self and he takes her to a dance.

title: Goodbye Camp Henderson, Hello Sergeant Carter
description: As the series ends Gomer requests a transfer to get out of Sergeant Carter's hair and the Sergeant kills the transfer. This series had great characters but poor writing often repeating the same plots in multiple shows season to season.
